medical_history.chief_complaint: Marked erythrocytosis and prominent mitochondrial alterations due to germline VHL deficiency.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient experienced early systemic onset, with prenatal bradycardia and severe neonatal hypoglycemia. Symptoms included failure to thrive noted a few months after birth, requiring recombinant growth hormone treatment. Persistent hypoglycemia was treated with diazoxide for 3 years.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient underwent phlebotomy shortly after birth for elevated hemoglobin and hematocrit. Periodic phlebotomy treatments have continued since, with iron supplementation started at age 14 due to iron deficiency.
medical_history.family_history: The patient is the son of healthy consanguineous white Italian parents.
